info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 5 at 12:56PM AKST by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description: Water levels are projected to rise above the normal highest tide line this weekend. Minor flooding will be possible during overnight high tides on Friday night/early Saturday morning and Saturday night/early Sunday morning. The greatest potential for minor flooding will be in the community of Kwigillingok during the Saturday night/early Sunday morning high tide cycle where water levels could rise between 1.5 to 2.5 ft above the normal highest tide line. At levels above 2 ft, access to the airstrip and portions of the community could be threatened (via roads and boardwalks). Confidence is increasing on the potential for minor flooding, especially across Kwigillingok for the Saturday night/early Sunday morning timeframe. Water levels around the Kipnuk area are expected to be less than 2 ft above the normal highest tide line. Therefore, any impacts are expected to be minor (low-lying/flood prone areas). Please continue to monitor for updates to the forecast.

parameter.value: INCREASED WATER LEVELS FOR THE KUSKOKWIM COAST THIS WEEKEND

area.areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta Coast and Nunivak Island
